name: py-blosc2

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description: Python wrapper for the C-Blosc2 library.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-scikit-build
dependencies.description:
scikit-build is an improved build system generator for CPython
C/C++/Fortran/Cython extensions. It provides better support for
additional compilers, build systems, cross compilation, and locating
dependencies and their associated build requirements. The scikit-build
package is fundamentally just glue between the setuptools Python module
and CMake.

dependencies.name: py-cython
dependencies.description: The Cython compiler for writing C extensions for the Python language.

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: py-ninja
dependencies.description: Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependencies.name: py-ndindex
dependencies.description: A Python library for manipulating indices of ndarrays.

dependencies.name: py-py-cpuinfo
dependencies.description: Get CPU info with pure Python 2 & 3

dependent_to.name: py-tables
dependent_to.description:
PyTables is a package for managing hierarchical datasets and designed to
efficiently and easily cope with extremely large amounts of data.
